title: [CRASH] OOM Crash in `setrange`
body:
Notice!
- If a Redis module was involved, please open an issue in the module's repo instead!
- If you're using docker on Apple M1, please make sure the image you're using was compiled for ARM!


**Crash report**

Paste the complete crash log between the quotes below. Please include a few lines from the log preceding the crash report to provide some context.

```
3542777:C 31 Dec 2022 06:43:53.725 # oO0OoO0OoO0Oo Redis is starting oO0OoO0OoO0Oo
3542777:C 31 Dec 2022 06:43:53.725 # Redis version=255.255.255, bits=64, commit=af0a4fe2, modified=0, pid=3542777, just started
3542777:C 31 Dec 2022 06:43:53.725 # Configuration loaded
3542777:M 31 Dec 2022 06:43:53.726 * monotonic clock: POSIX clock_gettime
3542777:M 31 Dec 2022 06:43:53.726 * Running mode=standalone, port=6379.
3542777:M 31 Dec 2022 06:43:53.727 # Server initialized
3542777:M 31 Dec 2022 06:43:53.728 * Loading RDB produced by version 255.255.255
3542777:M 31 Dec 2022 06:43:53.728 * RDB age 9490 seconds
3542777:M 31 Dec 2022 06:43:53.728 * RDB memory usage when created 0.87 Mb
3542777:M 31 Dec 2022 06:43:53.728 * Done loading RDB, keys loaded: 2, keys expired: 0.
3542777:M 31 Dec 2022 06:43:53.728 * DB loaded from disk: 0.000 seconds
3542777:M 31 Dec 2022 06:43:53.728 * Ready to accept connections tcp
3542777:M 31 Dec 2022 06:44:27.006 # Out Of Memory allocating 9223372036854775826 bytes!


=== REDIS BUG REPORT START: Cut & paste starting from here ===
3542777:M 31 Dec 2022 06:44:27.006 # ------------------------------------------------
3542777:M 31 Dec 2022 06:44:27.006 # !!! Software Failure. Press left mouse button to continue
3542777:M 31 Dec 2022 06:44:27.006 # Guru Meditation: Redis aborting for OUT OF MEMORY. Allocating 9223372036854775826 bytes! #server.c:6690

=== REDIS BUG REPORT END. Make sure to include from START to END. ===

       Please report the crash by opening an issue on github:

           http://github.com/redis/redis/issues

  If a Redis module was involved, please open in the module's repo instead.

  Suspect RAM error? Use redis-server --test-memory to verify it.

  Some other issues could be detected by redis-server --check-system

```

**Additional information**

1. OS distribution and version
```
Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS
Redis ver: built from commit af0a4fe20771603f0eab75a1f60748d124cf33c3
```
2. Steps to reproduce (if any)

Run the following command in cli:
```
setrange somekey 9223372036854775807 e
```
